p: Chikungunya virus (CHIKV) infections have been reported worldwide since the virus was first isolated in Tanzania in 1953 [ 1]. Over 70 CHIKV epidemics have been reported around the world between 1959 and 2016 [ 2]. Only in the Americas, more than 1 million cases were notified in 2017, with Brazil reporting 185,593 cases [ 3, 4].
